page.title: 01COUNTRY WEST OF KEMPSFORD
page.content: The greater part consists of two parishes,{Castle Eaton}and{Marston {Meysey,}with the western edge of {Kempsford}(including the hamlet of {Dunfield).}The latter two may be considered as fringe Cotswold villages from their architecture and allegiances. The area is shared between{Gloucestershire}and{Wiltshire with the two former villages lying in {Wiltshire.}The{River Thames}is the county boundary for some distance although a finger of land containing {Marston Meysey}projects northwards into{Gloucestershire.}The land is flat, farm land. Winding, grass-verged narrow roads join the communities and lead out to the "A" roads and towns. The Royal Air Force airfield (generally known as{RAF Fairford)}lies within the parish of{Kempsford}.
